conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D view with extruded walls, visible thickness, and an angled/isometric-like perspective exposing interior spaces.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness, readable room volumes, correct multi-face wall geometry, and clean roof cutaway. Minor softness/simplification at some wall junctions.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and core arrangement (kitchen/living left, bedroom top-right, central bath/closet core, stairs/right circulation) largely matches. Notable exterior/footprint deviation: the 2D plan shows an outdoor/balcony strip on the left, but the 3D model appears to render a continuous exterior wall there. Some internal partition/door placements differ slightly around the central core.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (bed, sofa/seat, table), kitchen counters/appliances present, bathroom fixtures present. A few elements are simplified and some placements/orientations appear approximate relative to the 2D symbols.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with good visibility of walls/openings and minimal artifacts. Lighting is adequate and geometry is readable; minor ambiguity from uniform materials and simplified details.

detected_errors.description: Exterior layout/footprint mismatch: left-side balcony/outdoor strip in 2D plan is not represented as an open exterior space in the 3D model (renders as continuous wall/volume).
Some door/opening placements and/or swing orientations around the central core (bath/closet/circulation) do not perfectly align with the 2D plan.
Furniture is plausible but a few items appear approximate in position/scale compared to the 2D furniture symbols.

summary: A valid and clean cutaway 3D conversion with strong fundamentals and generally faithful room layout, but with a notable left-side exterior/balcony discrepancy and minor opening/partition mismatches.
